channel.title: Punk vs Metal
channel.description:
I honestly do not understand what is so different when it comes to their ideals, the music yes, but the thing is there's an underground beef I've been seeing allot of at slayer and rise against concerts. I'm an open minded guy, and apparently allot of slayer fans would love to 'crush the dicks of any inverted pussy punkie' and punks 'find that metal-heads are just full of shit'. This has been going on for about 3 years I've been going to concerts around the world.
They both have the same ideas, same anger, and same kinda lyrics. So please help me differentiate these two genres!

item.title: Punk vs Metal
item.dc:creator: @RSCShadow RSCShadow
item.description:
@RSCShadow wrote:

[quote=“3lv3n snip3r, post:37, topic:518037”][quote author=Rodgerwilco link=topic=636299.msg4303976#msg4303976 date=1369464028]

Since when has a metal record ever sold 20 million copies of their album out of their garage…

I go with punk.

Would heavy metal be in the metal category? If so, Led Zeppelin has sold 200-300 million copies world wide.

That would be all of their albums put together and not to mention they were signed under a label company.
One of the punk rock bands (Offspring? Bad Religion?) sold 20 million albums out of their garage without a record company. It’s in the vid.

http://www.yo utube.com/watch?v=mQmb70n5Cp0

[/quote]
Offspring have always been with a record company. First, it was Nemesis Records , then it was Epitaph Records. Bad Religion was also with Epitaph Records. Also, you quoted my post before I edited it:[/quote]Epitaph was created by the guitarist of Bad Religion.

The label was originally "just a logo and a P.O. box" created in the 1980s for the purpose of selling Bad Religion records

But I don’t see how that’s relevant to the topic.

Read full topic

item.title: Punk vs Metal
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Clawz fury, post:64, topic:518037”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=636299.msg4360467#msg4360467 date=1378618625]
That moment when Black Sabbath is considered hard (Or even at this point, classic) rock, not metal…
[/quote]
NO NO NO NO NO NO DONT START ON HERE

BLACK SABBATH IS METAL I DONT CARE WHAT YOU THINK SHUT THE FUCK UP[/quote]
I started on here before on skype. Ha.

Even the Black Sabbath members don’t consider themselves as metal:

Sabbath:

With their riff-based songs, extreme volume, and dark, demonic subject matter, Black Sabbath embodied key aspects of the heavy-metal aesthetic. Yet in their own words, Black Sabbath saw themselves as a “heavy underground” band.

Yes, it says they have a “heavy-metal aesthetic”, but you have to realize, that aesthetic means look…

item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

punk is way too simplistic

metal songs are way harder to play and sound a lot better

when people think of ‘screaming’ vocals they are usually thinking about metalcore/screamo (which everyone seems to think is real metal…) which is actually a hybridization of hardcore punk and metal

real metal:



(if you like black sabbath you’ll love these guys)

(some nice nwobhm)

item.title: Punk vs Metal
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

If you heard screaming we definitely weren’t listening to the same song lol, Cynic have a ‘death metal growl’ and an extremely tame one at that, but it isn’t the majority of the vocals. Cynic tone the growls down a hell of a lot in their second album as well, as seen here. As a minor note, Protest the Hero do death growls in at least some of their work, as seen here, from around 00:35.

Fair enough if Protest the Hero is the vocal style you like, I wouldn’t call them metal by a long shot at least in the vocal department, I can’t say what style it reminds me of but I think they have a very generic-ish style (not as an insult) that something like metalcore sang clean sounds like, perhaps even pop-rock or pop-punk. The closest metal-ish thing I can think of right now that comes close in vocals is Stratovarius or even Trivium, but they aren’t even close.

Read full topic
